page.title: 19HARTHILL PONDS
page.content: These three were dug out as drainage { for the Chesterfield{canal}which was built by{James Brindley}and{Hugh {Henshaw}between{1772}and{1777.}It runs east from the{River Trent}through Retford,Worksop, Kiveton park, Stavley and into Chesterfield. On the 15th June the{fishing}season started.They have taken down some banking and put up a bridge so the 1st and the 2nd pond flowin to each other. People take their{yachts}on the ponds and they are all given a number and a certain area to sail in. All sorts of{birds}nest around the pond like coots, ducks and moore hens. Geese fly over our house from the ponds.
